harina_selector.title: Choose your Base Flours
harina_selector.instructions: You can choose up to 5 types of flour and, if you like, also the type of cut. Configure and add all the breads you want and once added, below, choose the extras you prefer for each bread. The price of the bread, without counting the extras, is fixed: {{price}}.

info_page.title: + INFO
info_page.p1: What if I told you that bread can be much more than a simple accompaniment? In a world full of haste, we have forgotten the deep connection that exists between the most basic food and our health. I invite you to rediscover real bread, one that honors tradition, respects the land, and nourishes your body in a conscious way.
info_page.p2: Breads, buns, and mini bread rolls are not just products; they are the fruit of work designed so that your organism absorbs nutrients in the most balanced way possible. Each piece is 100% whole grain and made with organic flours, free of any type of additives. Here there is no room for strong or refined flours, nor for preservatives, industrial fats, or bread improvers. It is simply about returning to the origins.
info_page.p3: The recipe for this bread is a pact of purity: I only use natural sea salt from our Chiclana salt flats, mineral water, fresh yeast, and 100% organic whole flour. To this, we add, by choice, other ingredients such as raisins, walnuts, or pure honey, which also provide flavor and well-being naturally.
info_page.p4: This is the true heart of the elaboration process and the key to bread that really feels good. Beyond using high-quality ingredients, the secret lies in short and controlled fermentation. This process, sacrificed in industrial production, is fundamental for your digestion.
info_page.p5: Our body has its own processing system: amylases, enzymes present in saliva and the digestive tract, are responsible for breaking down starches. When bread has a very long fermentation, it becomes excessively acidic, which can inhibit the action of these natural enzymes.
info_page.p6: By opting for a shorter fermentation, we obtain bread with low acidity that respects the digestive and balanced functioning of your organism. It's like giving your digestive system a hand, not an obstacle. This translates into better assimilation of starches and a feeling of lightness and well-being after eating. It is not just a more digestive bread; it is bread that works in harmony with your body.

1.title: 1. Spelt
1.desc: It is a primitive wheat, whose properties are well known and appreciated since ancient times in Europe. Its nutritional value is comparable to that of oats. It is rich in proteins, carbohydrates, mineral salts, and vitamins A, B, and E, as well as magnesium, phosphorus, iron, and potassium. Its daily consumption reduces cholesterol levels and regulates metabolism. It offers a greater amount of essential amino acids than common wheat and also surpasses it in vitamin and mineral richness. Some people allergic to wheat digest spelt well.

2.title: 2. Khorasan
2.desc: It is an ancestral wheat from Egypt, rich in mineral salts and group B vitamins. Highly appreciated because it is low in gluten and produces fewer allergies or intolerances than modern wheats, since the human organism is more adapted to the type of protein of ancient wheats.

3.title: 3. Whole Wheat
3.desc: Processed (refined) wheat does not contain the best parts of the grain. During grain processing, 40% of its original content (germ and bran) is removed, leaving mainly the carbohydrates (sugars) of the endosperm, making it less nutritious. By preserving the bran and wheat germ, whole wheat flour stands out for a fiber amount 3 times higher than refined white flour, in addition to having a high content of vitamins and minerals, such as B complex vitamins, vitamin E, iron, potassium, magnesium, zinc, among others.

4.title: 4. Rye
4.desc: In addition to the minerals, vitamins, magnesium, phosphorus, and fiber it provides, it is a cereal highly appreciated for its blood purifying properties and for helping to maintain the elasticity of blood vessels.

5.title: 5. Tritordeum
5.desc: It is a hybrid cereal born from the natural combination of durum wheat and wild barley. It was discovered by Spanish researchers in the late 70s. It is NOT a genetically modified organism (GMO). It is the result of a natural cross. And it is registered as a new species in the European Union. It has a slightly sweet flavor, with a high content of oleic acid and lutein, and also has 30% more fiber than common wheat.

info_page.yeast: Natural or fresh yeast: unlike chemical baking powder, it is of biological origin, a living and active microscopic fungus. It is sold in supermarkets as fresh, natural, or baker's yeast.
info_page.salt: Natural sea salt has not been chemically treated: it is the consequence of the simple evaporation of seawater. Of course, 90% of its composition is chlorine and sodium naturally, but it contains a greater number of trace elements, minerals, and iodine that are of great nutritional relevance to the body. Taking unrefined sea salt in moderate amounts contributes to good toxin drainage, raises vitality, favors kidney function, improves sexuality, and reconstitutes bones and hair, in addition, it improves digestion favoring the generation of gastric juices.
info_page.commitment_title: The commitment of the artisan baker
info_page.p7: Behind each piece, there are hours of dedication and passion for an ancestral trade. It is not just about mixing ingredients, but a process of patience, of feeling the dough and understanding its times. Artisan elaboration guarantees that every bread that reaches your table is unique, with an authentic flavor and unmatched texture.
info_page.p8: This bread is for you if you are looking for a conscious and nutritious option that supports a healthier and more sustainable lifestyle, away from those heavy and fermentative digestions. Discover the pleasure of eating well without giving up flavor or quality, and feel the difference in such a nutritious food.
info_page.thanks: Thank you very much for trusting in this project. I enjoy baking for you and I hope you also enjoy every slice with health and joy. üçû üôè‚òÄÔ∏è
info_page.contact: If you need more information, contact me on my WhatsApp
info_page.tips_title: üçû Tips for optimal conservation of organic whole bread üçû
info_page.tip1: As you know, this 100% organic and whole bread is free of preservatives and artificial additives. The best way to preserve bread is in the refrigerator. Keep it inside the same paper bag and this in turn in a tightly closed plastic bag. Place it, preferably, on the highest shelf of your refrigerator, there it can last perfectly up to 3 or 4 days. Then it is preferable that you freeze the rest that you have not consumed.
info_page.tip2: If you prefer, you can also cut it into slices or portions that you are going to consume and freeze it directly on the day of delivery, always in a bag or a tightly closed container so that it does not generate frost.
info_page.tip3: Bread, buns, or mini bread rolls are always delivered fresh from the day, and sometimes even warm; if so, place it on the oven rack and always wait an hour from delivery to consume it. Do not store or freeze it in the refrigerator until you notice that it is completely cold. Thank you!! üôè
